title: The FOXP2 Gene and Speech
description: A quick, practical guide to The FOXP2 Gene and Speech.

hook.text: A single gene mutation in one British family made speech nearly impossible. Scientists called it the language gene.

buildup.text: The KE family had members across three generations who couldn't form words properly despite normal intelligence.

discovery.text: Researchers traced the problem to FOXP2 â€” a gene that controls the fine motor skills needed for speech.

twist.text: FOXP2 isn't unique to humans â€” mice, birds, and bats have versions. It's not a 'language gene' after all.

climax.text: Language requires hundreds of genes working together. There's no single switch that turns speech on.

punchline.text: One gene helps us speak. But language takes a whole genome.

quiz.question: What does the FOXP2 gene control?
options: Fine motor skills needed for speech
